intro: Orbea huillensis subsp. flava, commonly known as the yellow orbea, is a succulent plant native to the arid regions of South America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, cylindrical stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces bright yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, often during the warmer months. Its leaves are typically small and arranged in a spiral pattern along the stem. Orbea huillensis subsp. flava is adapted to survive in dry environments, storing water in its thick, fleshy stems.
